data.title: Marie Henriette, Archduchess of Austria, Duchess of Brabant, later Queen of the Belgians (1836
data.meta_description: Nicaise de Keyser (1813-87) studied at the Academy in Antwerp with Mathieu Ignace Van Br√©e. He exhibited altarpieces influenced by Rubens at the Salons of 1834 and 1835. After success in 1836 with his huge canvas, Battle of the Gold Spurs, he received commissions from royalty and from prominent families at home and abroad. In 1848 he became a member of the Koninklijke Academy in Brussels, and in 1855 he was appointed director of the Academy in Antwerp. His large history paintings and his genre...
